title: Yakshagana
short_description: A traditional theatre form that combines dance, music, dialogue, heavy makeup, and elaborate costumes.
long_description:
Yakshagana is a traditional theatre form that combines dance, music, dialogue, costume, make-up, and stage techniques with a unique style and form. It is found in the coastal districts of Karnataka. 

Yakshagana literally means the song (gana) of the Yaksha (nature spirits). It is a night-long performance where actors wear massive headgears and elaborate costumes to enact stories from the Ramayana, Mahabharata, and Puranas. Unlike Kathakali, actors in Yakshagana speak dialogues (often improvised) in addition to dancing.
costume_and_makeup: Spectacular. Huge circular headgears (Kirita), vibrant red and yellow face paints, and heavy ornaments.

top_places.title: Udupi Sri Krishna Matha
top_places.summary: Regular performances in the temple premises.

practical_info.audience_tips: The drum beats (Chande) are extremely loud and piercing. Be prepared.
